textbooks.title: The Mythical Man-month: Essays on Software Engineering
textbooks.author: F.P. Brooks

assignments.description: Logbook Assignment - At least 10 entries in Microsoft Word or '.txt' format due by the end of the 12th week.
Team problem assignment - Each half of the course includes a 2-week assignment.

policies.attendance: Attendance will be taken in every class. Students are responsible for all assigned work if they miss a class.
policies.late_work: Assignments must be submitted on time; late submissions will be rejected.
policies.academic_integrity: Plagiarism is intolerable; violations will result in no points for the assignment and a reduction in letter grade.
policies.accommodations: Students needing accommodations should discuss this with the instructor during the first week of classes.

_metadata.course_description: This course introduces the subject of software engineering from a quantitative, analytic- and metrics-based point of view.
learning_outcomes: Understanding the consequential issues when the proper software engineering methods are ignored.
Understand the impact of requirements and architecture planning on software development.
Able to evaluate newer methods and practices in software engineering.
